abstract: Berkshire Hathaway, the investment vehicle of famed value investor Warren E. Buffett, has revealed its end-of-2006 stock positions, including its $843 million stake in Minneapolis-based U.S. Bancorp. From January through September of last year, Berkshire built up its U.S. Bancorp holdings by 23.3 million shares, representing a 1.3 percent stake in the bank, the nation’s sixth-largest by assets. Because so many investors watch Mr. Buffett’s portfolio, regulators sometimes allow his firm to delay disclosures of its trades in an effort to forestall market mimicry.
